amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase National Recreation and Preservation funding by $10 million and reduce fossil energy research and development funding by the same amount.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 21 in the Congressional Record of June 18, 1996, to increase the funds appropriated in the bill for the National Park Service by $10 million and to decrease the fossil energy research and development program within the Department of Energy by a comparable amount. The intent of the amendment is to provide funding for the rehabilitation of urban parks.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Miller (CA) amendment (A010) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 223 (Roll no. 256).
